eshmun.expression.guard

Class OrGuardOperator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.expression.guard.GuardExpression
      • eshmun.expression.guard.OrGuardOperator

  • public class OrGuardOperator
extends GuardExpression
    Represents an OR Operator on Guards. Semantically, this means that at least one inner guard expression must be true for this to be true. The resulting assignment is the combined assignment of any inner guard expression that is satisfied.

    Invariant: it is guaranteed that no direct child of any OrGuardOperator is an OrGuardOperator.

    Author:
    kinan

        public OrGuardOperator(GuardExpression... children)

    • Method Detail

      • orGuard

        public void orGuard(GuardExpression exp)
        Adds a new guard expression to the or statement.

        if the child is an OrGuardOperator its children will be added.

        Invariant: it is guaranteed that no direct child of any OrGuardOperator is an OrGuardOperator.

        Parameters:
        exp - the child to be added.

      • satisfyGuard

        public java.util.HashSet<java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> satisfyGuard(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> state,
                                                                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processes)
                                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Given the current state of processes and shared variables, determine if this guard is satisfied.
        Specified by:
        satisfyGuard in class GuardExpression
        Parameters:
        state - a collection of labels and shared variables (with assignments).
        processes - a list of considered process indices, any boolean variable that does not belong to these processes is not considered.
        Returns:
        a set of effects and action names. Actions begin with "@". The outer set represents a "disjunction", in other words. Each of its elements is the effect of a separate transition. The inner set represents a "conjunction", its elements are concatenated into a single effect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state does not satisfy the guard.

      • simplify

        public GuardExpression simplify()
        Simplifies the guard. Turns the guard into the following format: ( ( Guard1 -> Assignment 1 (OR) Guard2 -> Assignment 2 (OR) ... ) (AND) ( Guard3 -> Asssignment3 (OR) ...) (AND) ... ) This also combines expression that have the same guard or the same assignments.
        Specified by:
        simplify in class GuardExpression
        Returns:
        the simplified guard as explained.

      • directCompare

        protected boolean directCompare(GuardExpression exp)
        Two OrGuardOperators are equal if they contain the same set of children (regardless of order).
        Specified by:
        directCompare in class GuardExpression
        Parameters:
        exp - the guard expression to compare this with.
        Returns:
        true if this and the passed object are semantically equal (as Expressions), false otherwise.
